title: Tucker Carlson
added: In 2018, a group of [[Antifa (United States)|antifa]] activists associated with the "Smash Racism D.C." group protested outside Carlson's [[Washington, D.C.]], home.<ref name="WaPo.Threatening">{{cite news|last=Chiu|first=Allyson|date=November 8, 2018|title='They were threatening me and my family': Tucker Carlson's home targeted by protesters|work=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/08/they-were-threatening-me-my-family-tucker-carlsons-home-targeted-by-protesters/|url-status=live|access-date=January 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181229143955/https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/08/they-were-threatening-me-my-family-tucker-carlsons-home-targeted-by-protesters/|archive-date=December 29, 2018}}</ref> Carlson's driveway was vandalized with a spray-painted [[Anarchist symbolism|anarchist symbol]]. Police responded within minutes and the protesters were dispersed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fieldstadt|first1=Elisha|title=Antifa group chants outside, vandalizes Fox commentator Tucker Carlson's home|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/antifa-group-chants-outside-vandalizes-fox-commentator-tucker-carlson-s-n934131|url-status=live|access-date=January 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181126153143/https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/antifa-group-chants-outside-vandalizes-fox-commentator-tucker-carlson-s-n934131|archive-date=November 26, 2018}}</ref>

title: Tucker Carlson
added: * Kurtz, Howard. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/1999/08/17/the-opinionated-journalist/4340b332-e33d-442b-b681-fbb97cffee71/ "The Opinionated Journalist,"] ''[[The Washington Post]],'' August 17, 1999.

title: Tucker Carlson
deleted: On February 10, 2021, Carlson falsely claimed that "There was no physical evidence that George Floyd was murdered by a cop." and that "The autopsy showed that George Floyd almost certainly died of a [[drug overdose]]—[[fentanyl]]".<ref name=":11">{{Cite web|last=Kiley|first=Rachel|date=2021-02-11|title=Tucker Carlson Falsely Claims That George Floyd Wasn’t Killed by Cops|url=https://www.dailydot.com/irl/tucker-carlson-george-floyd-not-killed-by-cops/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-02-11|website=[[The Daily Dot]]|language=en-US}}</ref> Both the first and second autopsies of Floyd determined that he died from [[Homicide|homocide]] caused by former [[police officer]] [[Derek Chauvin]] kneeling on Floyd’s neck for more than [[Eight minutes 46 seconds|eight minutes]].<ref name=":11" /> While Floyd did have [[Drug|drugs]] in his system when he died, medical professionals determined that it was not the cause of his death.<ref name=":11" />

title: Tucker Carlson
added: * Bump, Philip. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/01/14/tucker-carlson-is-making-his-play-be-post-trump-maga-champion/ "Tucker Carlson is making his play to be the post-Trump MAGA champion"] ''[[The Washington Post]],'' January 14, 2021.

title: Tucker Carlson
added: Of illegal immigration, Carlson said in May 2019, "The flood of illegal workers into the United States has damaged our communities, ruined our schools, burdened our healthcare system and fractured our [[national unity]]."<ref name=":6" />InDecember2019,hefalselyclaimedthatimmigrantswereresponsibleformakingthe[[PotomacRiver]]"dirtieranddirtier."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.politifact.com/punditfact/statements/2019/dec/18/tucker-carlson/carlson-falsely-claims-immigrants-are-dirtying-pot/|title=TuckerCarlsonwrongaboutPotomacRiverlitter|website=@politifact|language=en|access-date=December20,2019}}</ref><ref>{{Citenews|url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/dec/17/tucker-carlson-potomac-river-immigrants-litter-racist-remarks|title=CleanwatergroupdenouncesTuckerCarlson's'racist'littercomments|last=Pilkington|first=Ed|date=December17,2019|work=TheGuardian|access-date=December20, 2019|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

Heidi Beirich of the [[Southern Poverty Law Center]] said that "Carlson probably has been the No.{{nbsp}}1 commentator mainstreaming bedrock principles of [[white nationalism]] in [the U.S.]," and accused him of promoting the [[white genocide conspiracy theory]], the idea that white people are under attack by minorities and immigrants.<ref>[https://forward.com/news/national/420970/why-do-white-supremacists-love-tucker-carlson-so-much/]</ref> Critics have accused Carlson's show of promoting racism, a charge which he has denied.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/28/media/fox-news-laura-ingraham-tucker-carlson-white-nationalism/index.html|title=White anxiety finds a home at Fox News|last1=Kludt|first1=Tom|last2=Stelter|first2=Brian|publisher=[[CNN Business]]|access-date=September 29, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181005200259/https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/28/media/fox-news-laura-ingraham-tucker-carlson-white-nationalism/index.html|archive-date=October 5, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vox.com/2018/3/21/17146866/tucker-carlson-demographics-immigration-fox-news|title=Watch: Tucker Carlson rails against America's demographic changes|work=[[Vox (website)|Vox]]|access-date=September 29, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180321175631/https://www.vox.com/2018/3/21/17146866/tucker-carlson-demographics-immigration-fox-news|archive-date=March 21, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Neoconservative]] pundit [[Bill Kristol]] described the views Carlson expressed on his show with these words, "I don’t know if it’s racism exactly — but [[Ethnic nationalism|ethno-nationalism]] of some kind, let’s call it."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/01/24/bill-kristol-takes-on-fox-news-tucker-carlson.html|title=Bill Kristol hits Fox News, Tucker Carlson for 'dumbing down' coverage, pushing 'ethno-nationalism'|last=Harwood|first=John|date=January 25, 2018|publisher=[[CNBC]]|access-date=March 20, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180319161614/https://www.cnbc.com/2018/01/24/bill-kristol-takes-on-fox-news-tucker-carlson.html|archive-date=March 19, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> Carlson responded that Kristol had "discredited himself years ago."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mediaite.com/tv/tucker-fires-back-at-bill-kristol-former-intellectual-who-now-exists-primarily-on-twitter/|title=Tucker Fires Back at Bill Kristol: 'Former Intellectual Who Now Exists Primarily on Twitter'|publisher=[[Mediaite]]|access-date=March 20, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180321063046/https://www.mediaite.com/tv/tucker-fires-back-at-bill-kristol-former-intellectual-who-now-exists-primarily-on-twitter/|archive-date=March 21, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> Carlson has denied being a racist and has said he hates racism.<ref name=":102" />
